roleset.name: introduce a phosphate group into an organic compound

role.descr: thing phosphorylated (e.g. protein or another organic molecule)
product of phosphorylation (e.g. protein or another organic molecule)

example.name: phosphorylate-v: passivized, with product of the reaction
example.text: What is most striking in our proteomic analysis of PHF is the abundance of MAP peptides phosphorylated from MAP1 .

example.name: phosphorylate-v: volitional agent and instrument
example.text: To first address the former possibility , we phosphorylated PTEN in vitro with CK2 and analyzed the phosphorylation by autoradiography , tryptic peptide mapping , phosphoamino acid analysis , and tandem mass spectrometry .

propbank.arg: To first address the former possibility

example.name: phosphorylation-n
example.text: Reversible phosphorylation of proteins is an important regulatory mechanism that occurs in both prokaryotic and eukaryotic organisms .

roleset.note: PHOSPHORYLATE-V NOTES: Created for Bio-AMR annotations.
